info.title: ApiManagementClient
info.description: Use these REST APIs for managing OAuth2 servers configuration in your Azure API Management deployment. OAuth 2.0 can be used to authorize developer accounts for Azure API Management. For more information refer to [How to OAuth2](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/api-management/api-management-howto-oauth2).

get.description: Lists a collection of authorization servers defined within a service instance.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: |   Field     |     Usage     |     Supported operators     |     Supported functions     |</br>|-------------|-------------|-------------|-------------|</br>| name | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>| displayName | filter | ge, le, eq, ne, gt, lt | substringof, contains, startswith, endswith | </br>

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Number of records to return.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Number of records to skip.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: A Collection of the Authorization Server entities for the specified API Management service instance.

schema.description: Paged OAuth2 Authorization Servers list representation.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets the details of the authorization server specified by its identifier.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: authsid
parameters.description: Identifier of the authorization server.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

200.description: Gets the details of the specified authorization server.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

put.description: Creates new authorization server or updates an existing authorization server.

parameters.name: resourceGroupName
parameters.description: The name of the resource group.

parameters.name: serviceName
parameters.description: The name of the API Management service.

parameters.name: authsid
parameters.description: Identifier of the authorization server.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. Not required when creating an entity, but required when updating an entity.

parameters.name: api-version
parameters.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request.

parameters.name: subscriptionId
parameters.description: Subscription credentials which uniquely identify Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

clientId.description: Client or app id registered with this authorization server.

clientRegistrationEndpoint.description: Optional reference to a page where client or app registration for this authorization server is performed. Contains absolute URL to entity being referenced.

clientSecret.description: Client or app secret registered with this authorization server. This property will not be filled on 'GET' operations! Use '/listSecrets' POST request to get the value.

grantTypes.description: Form of an authorization grant, which the client uses to request the access token.

properties.description: External OAuth authorization server settings Properties.

type.description: Resource type for API Management resource.

ETag.description: Current entity state version. Should be treated as opaque and used to make conditional HTTP requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

parameters.description: Identifier of the authorization server.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: ETag of the Entity. ETag should match the current entity state from the header response of the GET request or it should be * for unconditional update.
